fields.value: Replication Data for: Advances in using Internet searches to track dengue

dsDescriptionValue.value: This dataset contains all the data to replicate the analysis performed in the manuscript entitled: "Advances in using Internet searches to track dengue" to be published in the journal PLoS Computational Biology in 2017. Specifically, it contains data for five countries/states: Mexico, Brazil, Thailand, Singapore and Taiwan. For each country/state, the data include: (1) Google Trends data, (2) Google Dengue Trends data, (3) official dengue case counts published by the government.

publicationCitation.value: Yang S, Kou SC, Lu F, Brownstein JS, Brooke N, Santillana M (2017) Advances in using Internet searches to track dengue. PLoS Comput Biol 13(7): e1005607. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005607

files.description:
The dengue case count for Brazil. 

The first column is the original file name. The second column is the month label. The third column is the dengue case count for the month specified in the second column.

Monthly dengue case counts data from January 2001 to December 2012 were obtained from the old website of Brazil's Ministry of Health (http://dtr2004.saude.gov.br/sinanweb/tabnet/dh?sinannet/dengue/bases/denguebrnet.def) on July 14, 2015.
files.label: CaseCount(Brazil).tab

dataFile.description:
The dengue case count for Brazil. 

The first column is the original file name. The second column is the month label. The third column is the dengue case count for the month specified in the second column.

Monthly dengue case counts data from January 2001 to December 2012 were obtained from the old website of Brazil's Ministry of Health (http://dtr2004.saude.gov.br/sinanweb/tabnet/dh?sinannet/dengue/bases/denguebrnet.def) on July 14, 2015.

files.description: Monthly-aggregated dengue case counts data from January 2001 to August 2015 were obtained from Mexico's Department of Epidemiology. (http://www.epidemiologia.salud.gob.mx/anuario/html/anuarios.html)
files.label: CaseCount(Mexico).tab

dataFile.description: Monthly-aggregated dengue case counts data from January 2001 to August 2015 were obtained from Mexico's Department of Epidemiology. (http://www.epidemiologia.salud.gob.mx/anuario/html/anuarios.html)

files.description:
Weekly dengue case counts were obtained from the Singapore Ministry of Health (https://www.moh.gov.sg/content/moh_web/home/statistics/infectiousDiseasesStatistics/weekly_infectiousdiseasesbulletin.html).
The time stamp is the ending Saturday of the week.
files.label: CaseCount(Singapore).tab

dataFile.description:
Weekly dengue case counts were obtained from the Singapore Ministry of Health (https://www.moh.gov.sg/content/moh_web/home/statistics/infectiousDiseasesStatistics/weekly_infectiousdiseasesbulletin.html).
The time stamp is the ending Saturday of the week.

files.description: Weekly dengue case counts were obtained from the Taiwan Ministry of Health and Welfare and were aggregated into months (http://nidss.cdc.gov.tw/ch/SingleDisease.aspx?dc=1&dt=4&disease=061&position=1). Time stamp is the ending Saturday of the week.
files.label: CaseCount(Taiwan).tab

dataFile.description: Weekly dengue case counts were obtained from the Taiwan Ministry of Health and Welfare and were aggregated into months (http://nidss.cdc.gov.tw/ch/SingleDisease.aspx?dc=1&dt=4&disease=061&position=1). Time stamp is the ending Saturday of the week.

files.description: Monthly dengue case count data were obtained from the Bureau of Epidemiology, Thailand (http://www.boe.moph.go.th/boedb/surdata/disease.php?ds=66). The date stamp is the first day of the month.
files.label: CaseCount(Thailand).tab

dataFile.description: Monthly dengue case count data were obtained from the Bureau of Epidemiology, Thailand (http://www.boe.moph.go.th/boedb/surdata/disease.php?ds=66). The date stamp is the first day of the month.

files.description: Google Trends (GT) data for Brazil. The first column is the ending Saturday of the week, and GT values are for that week. For this study, weekly data is aggregated into monthly by summing up (potentially fractional) weekly values in the corresponding month.
files.label: GT_Brazil.tab

dataFile.description: Google Trends (GT) data for Brazil. The first column is the ending Saturday of the week, and GT values are for that week. For this study, weekly data is aggregated into monthly by summing up (potentially fractional) weekly values in the corresponding month.
